title: Business Requirements Document (BRD)
content:
Business Requirements Document (BRD)

Project Title: InvenSync – AI-Driven Stock Reconciliation and Transparency Platform

Tagline: “Synchronizing Every Stock Move.”
Document Version: v0.1
Prepared By: [Pavan / ThinkBridge]
Date: [07/11/2025]

1. Executive Summary

Warehouse owners and managers often face reconciliation challenges between billed and non-billed dispatches due to manual processes and fragmented systems.

InvenSync aims to resolve these discrepancies by introducing an AI-powered optical reading and reconciliation platform. It automates the extraction of manual bill data, syncs it with POS and inventory records, and provides real-time stock visibility through role-based dashboards.

The solution promotes transparency, minimizes manual intervention, and strengthens trust between operational stakeholders.

2. Business Case

2.1 Current Challenges

  • Manual tracking of non-billed dispatches leading to inconsistent reporting.

  • Dependence on images or handwritten notes without standardized validation.

  • Delay in reconciling data between POS and physical stock.

  • Limited visibility for owners; data is often fragmented across systems.

  • Increased potential for errors, disputes, or revenue leakage.

2.2 Business Need

A unified digital system that automatically reads manual bills, reconciles stock, and updates inventory in real-time to:

  • Improve operational accuracy,

  • Strengthen accountability, and

  • Provide management insights into stock and sales movements.

2.3 Strategic Impact

  • Enhance trust and transparency in stock management.

  • Enable data-driven decisions and faster reconciliations.

  • Lay the foundation for future IT service extensions (analytics, cash flow, incentive programs, etc.).

3. Project Objectives

#

Objective

Expected Outcome

1

Automate reconciliation between manual bills and POS data

Reduce manual verification time by 70%

2

Enable real-time stock updates using AI Optical Reading

Ensure 100% visibility of stock status

3

Provide distinct views for Owner, Manager, and Sub-users

Improve transparency and accountability

4

Integrate POS and manual bill records under one platform

Eliminate reporting mismatches

5

Deliver weekly/monthly analytics reports

Enable performance and profit tracking

6

Build a scalable system for future IT services

Extend solution to broader enterprise needs

4. Project Scope

4.1 In-Scope

  • AI Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for bill reading.

  • Image upload via mobile camera or file input.

  • Stock reconciliation logic for automatic quantity adjustment.

  • Integration with POS reference data.

  • Role-based dashboards (Owner, Manager, User).

  • Alerts and notifications for stock discrepancies.

  • Reporting and data export (Excel/Cloud).

4.2 Out of Scope (Phase 1)

  • Profit and revenue analysis dashboards.

  • Subscription and client incentive modules.

  • Advanced cash flow management.

  • API integrations beyond POS.

  • Multi-language support.

(These may be included in Phase 2 or later enhancement releases.)

5. Functional Requirements (High-Level)

Module

Description

Key Functions

Bill Capture Module

Enables image upload of manual bills

Upload, preview, validate

AI Reading Engine

Extracts data from uploaded bills

OCR extraction, field mapping

Reconciliation Engine

Matches bill data with POS/inventory

Compare, verify, auto-adjust stock

Inventory Dashboard

Displays stock status & updates

Owner/Manager view, filters, alerts

POS Integration Layer

Connects POS data to InvenSync

Fetch bills, reference GST/invoice ID

Reporting Module

Generates summaries and alerts

Weekly/monthly reports, exports

6. Non-Functional Requirements

Category

Requirement

Performance

Real-time stock update within 5 seconds of bill validation

Accuracy

Minimum 95% OCR text recognition accuracy

Security

Role-based access; encrypted data transfer

Scalability

Support for multiple godowns and concurrent users

Reliability

System uptime of 99% or higher

Usability

Simple, mobile-friendly UI for non-technical users

7. Key Stakeholders

Role

Responsibility

Owner

Approve reconciliation, view summary dashboards

Manager

Upload manual bills, track updates

Sub-user

Input or validate individual sales data

IT / Development Team

Build, test, and deploy the system

POS Vendor

Provide integration data/API access

8. Risks & Dependencies

Risk

Impact

Mitigation

Poor image quality of manual bills

OCR accuracy drop

Introduce image quality validation & retry feature

Mismatch between POS and manual fields

Reconciliation delays

Standardize data mapping templates

Low adoption by staff

Limited benefit realization

Training and simplified UI design

Integration limitations with POS vendor

Partial automation

Start with CSV/API-based sync

9. Success Metrics

Metric

Target

Reduction in reconciliation time

≥ 70%

Accuracy of stock updates

≥ 95%

User adoption rate (Managers/Owners)

≥ 90%

Reduction in stock discrepancies

≥ 80%

System uptime

≥ 99%

10. Implementation Roadmap (Indicative)

Phase

Duration

Deliverables

Phase 1 – MVP

6–8 weeks

OCR Engine, POS sync, Owner/Manager dashboard

Phase 2 – Reporting & Analytics

+6 weeks

Weekly/monthly reports, profit view

Phase 3 – Financial Extensions

+8 weeks

Subscription model, incentive module, intranet integration

11. Future Enhancements (Beyond MVP)

  • Advanced AI learning for multilingual bill formats.

  • Integration with ERP and accounting software.

  • Predictive analytics for demand and cash flow.

  • Web portal for multi-location owners.

12. Conclusion

InvenSync introduces a modern, AI-enabled approach to warehouse stock management — bridging the long-standing gap between manual and digital records.
It focuses on accuracy, transparency, and operational efficiency, laying the groundwork for future IT-driven scalability and data intelligence.
